title: my-hdat9800-blog
text:
title: “Flight Delays Analysis”
author: “Abdullah”
date: “2025-06-12”
categories: [nycflights13, ggplot2, dplyr]
format: html

## Introduction
This post explores flight delays in NYC using the `nycflights13` dataset.
## Analysis
```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(nycflights13)
library(ggplot2)
delay <- flights %>%
group_by(tailnum, carrier) %>%
summarise(
count = n(),
dist = mean(distance, na.rm = TRUE),
delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE)
) %>%
filter(count > 20, dist < 2000, carrier %in% c(‘UA’, ‘DL’, ‘AA’, ‘US’)) %>%
left_join(airlines)
ggplot(delay, aes(dist, delay)) +
geom_point(aes(size = count), alpha = 0.5, color = “blue”) +
geom_smooth(color = “red”) +
scale_size_area() +
labs(
x = “Distance (miles)”,
y = “Delay (minutes)”,
size = “# of flights”
) +
ggtitle(“Flight delay”) +
facet_grid(. ~ name)
##Conclusion
Flight delays differ between airlines and distances. Some carriers show higher average delays than others.

title: my-hdat9800-blog
text:
title: “Flight Delays Analysis”
author: “Abdullah”
date: “2025-06-12”
categories: [nycflights13, ggplot2, dplyr]
format: html

## Introduction
This post explores flight delays in NYC using the `nycflights13` dataset. The aim is to analyze average arrival delays and flight distances for selected airlines.
## Analysis
```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(nycflights13)
library(ggplot2)
```
```{r}
delay <- flights %>%
group_by(tailnum, carrier) %>%
summarise(
count = n(),
dist = mean(distance, na.rm = TRUE),
delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE)
) %>%
filter(count > 20, dist < 2000, carrier %in% c(‘UA’, ‘DL’, ‘AA’, ‘US’)) %>%
left_join(airlines)
```
```{r}
ggplot(delay, aes(dist, delay)) +
geom_point(aes(size = count), alpha = 0.5, color = “blue”) +
geom_smooth(color = “red”) +
scale_size_area() +
labs(
x = “Distance (miles)”,
y = “Delay (minutes)”,
size = “# of flights”
) +
ggtitle(“Flight delay”) +
facet_grid(. ~ name)
```
## Conclusion
The plot shows variations in flight delays across different airlines and distances. Some carriers experience longer average delays, while others maintain more consistent performance over different flight lengths.
